hook.text: You drove home and can't remember a single turn. Your body was present. Your mind was somewhere else.

buildup.text: Mindfulness means paying attention to the present moment on purpose and without judgment.

discovery.text: Jon Kabat-Zinn brought mindfulness from Buddhist tradition into Western medicine in 1979.

twist.text: Mindfulness is not about emptying the mind. It's about noticing what's already there without reacting.

climax.text: Awareness itself changes the experience. Noticing stress without judgment reduces its grip on you.

punchline.text: Mindfulness is noticing, not fixing. That's enough.

quiz.question: What does mindfulness mean?
options: Paying attention to the present moment without judgment
